## blockRendering.BottomRow class

An object containing information about what elements are in the bottom row of a block as well as spacing information for the bottom row. Elements in a bottom row can consist of corners, spacers and next connections.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare class BottomRow extends Row 
```
**Extends:** [Row](./blockly.blockrendering.row.md)

## Constructors

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [(constructor)(constants)](./blockly.blockrendering.bottomrow._constructor_.md) |  | Constructs a new instance of the <code>BottomRow</code> class |

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [baseline](./blockly.blockrendering.bottomrow.baseline.md) |  | number | The Y position of the bottom edge of the block, relative to the origin of the block rendering. |
|  [connection](./blockly.blockrendering.bottomrow.connection.md) |  | [NextConnection](./blockly.blockrendering.nextconnection.md) \| null | The next connection on the row, if any. |
|  [descenderHeight](./blockly.blockrendering.bottomrow.descenderheight.md) |  | number | The amount that the bottom of the block extends below the horizontal edge, e.g. because of a next connection. Must be non-negative (see \#2820). |
|  [hasNextConnection](./blockly.blockrendering.bottomrow.hasnextconnection.md) |  | boolean | Whether this row has a next connection. |
